conclusion: The problem involves understanding the relationship between the forces acting on the blocks and the given conditions, where blocks are connected by a spring and a force F is applied to block B.
Four blocks (A, B, C, D) are placed on a smooth horizontal surface. Blocks B and C are connected by a spring, and a horizontal force F is applied to block B.
The force F is the sum of the forces exerted by the spring on block B and the frictional force on block D.
Since block B accelerates with the same acceleration a, the force F is equal to the sum of the frictional force f on block D and the spring force on block B.
The frictional force f on block D is given by f = ma. The spring force on block B is F - f.
Since block B accelerates with the same acceleration a, the spring force F - f must equal the frictional force f on block D. Therefore, F - f = ma.
Since the spring force F - f is the same for all blocks, and block D experiences the same acceleration as block B, the frictional force f on block D is also ma.
Thus, the magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is ma.
